title_en: SmartGuide – AI-Powered Guide Robot for the Visually Impaired
purpose_en: To assist visually impaired individuals in navigating safely through both indoor and outdoor environments. The robot provides real-time audio instructions via Bluetooth-connected earbuds and utilizes AI-powered perception systems to detect obstacles and guide the user. The robot is designed to operate for at least 3 hours on a single charge.

hardware_components: Mobile robotic body (wheeled or quadruped format)
Raspberry Pi 4 or NVIDIA Jetson Nano (computing unit)
software_components: Text-to-Speech system (e.g., gTTS, Amazon Polly) for voice guidance
bluetooth_audio_communication: Sends voice instructions such as “Turn right,” “Obstacle ahead,” etc., directly to the user’s earphones.
Enhanced voice guidance through integrated TTS engine.

key_features_table_en.description: Identifies people, vehicles, stairs, and various objects in real-time.
Sends directional commands to the user’s Bluetooth earbuds.
GPS for outdoor areas; SLAM-based localization for indoors.
Optionally guides or follows the user safely.
Sends alerts with GPS location in dangerous situations.
Ensures at least 3 hours of operation and alerts user before shutdown.

example_use_case_en: Ahmed, a visually impaired person, charges the robot in the morning and takes it on his walk. Through his Bluetooth earbuds, the robot says, “Turn right in 5 meters.” As a bicycle approaches, the robot warns: “Caution! A bicycle is passing quickly on your right.” Ahmed can stop or change direction via voice commands.
development_plan_en: Battery testing, emergency protocol, user testing (1–2 months)
future_upgrades_en: Social interaction filters (e.g., “Ahmed doesn’t need help, just passing by”)
Advanced voice command processing with models like GPT-4 or Whisper
